storage
Interface Command

All Known Implementing Classes:
StorageServer
public interface Command

Storage server command interface.

The naming server uses this interface to communicate commands to the storage server.

All methods in this interface may raise NullPointerException if passed null for arguments or SecurityException if the security manager on the server does not allow an operation.

Method Summary
 boolean copy(Path file, Storage server)
          Copies a file from another storage server.
 boolean create(Path file)
          Creates a file on the storage server.
 boolean delete(Path path)
          Deletes a file or directory on the storage server.
 

Method Detail

create

boolean create(Path file)
               throws RMIException
Creates a file on the storage server.

Parameters:
file - Path to the file to be created. The parent directory will be created if it does not exist. This path may not be the root directory.
Returns:
true if the file is created; false if it cannot be created.
Throws:
RMIException - If the call cannot be completed due to a network error.

delete

boolean delete(Path path)
               throws RMIException
Deletes a file or directory on the storage server.

If the file is a directory and cannot be deleted, some, all, or none of its contents may be deleted by this operation.

Parameters:
path - Path to the file or directory to be deleted. The root directory cannot be deleted.
Returns:
true if the file or directory is deleted; false otherwise.
Throws:
RMIException - If the call cannot be completed due to a network error.

copy

boolean copy(Path file,
             Storage server)
             throws RMIException,
                    FileNotFoundException,
                    IOException
Copies a file from another storage server.

Parameters:
file - Path to the file to be copied.
server - Storage server from which the file is to be downloaded.
Returns:
true if the file is successfully copied; false otherwise.
Throws:
FileNotFoundException - If the file is not present on the remote storage server, or the path refers to a directory.
IOException - If an I/O exception occurs either on the remote or on this storage server.
RMIException - If the call cannot be completed due to a network error, whether between the caller and this storage server, or between the two storage servers.
